question: [File: aptos-core/config/src/config/indexer_table_info_config.rs] [Struct: IndexerTableInfoConfig] [Integer overflow] Can parser_task_count be set to u16::MAX (65535), causing integer overflow when multiplied by parser_batch_size in batch calculation logic (table_info_service.rs:373-386), potentially leading to memory exhaustion or incorrect transaction processing? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/indexer_table_info_config.rs] [Struct: IndexerTableInfoConfig] [Arithmetic edge case] When parser_batch_size is 1 and parser_task_count is u16::MAX, does the batch calculation in get_batches() correctly handle edge cases, or can it create overlapping version ranges causing duplicate transaction processing? [File: aptos-core/config/src/config/indexer_table_info_config.rs] [Struct: IndexerTableInfoConfig] [Thread pool exhaustion] When parser_task_count * parser_batch_size exceeds safe limits, can this cause the tokio runtime to spawn excessive threads, depleting OS thread limits and crashing the node? [File: aptos-core/config/src/config/indexer_table_info_config.rs] [Struct: IndexerTableInfoConfig] [Database connection exhaustion] Can extremely high parser_task_count values cause all tasks to simultaneously query the database in fetch_raw_txns_with_retries(), exhausting database connection pool and blocking critical consensus operations? [File: aptos-core/config/src/config/indexer_table_info_config.rs] [Default: DEFAULT_PARSER_TASK_COUNT] [Resource bounds] Is the default value of 20 for parser_task_count adequately tested under adversarial conditions, or can it still cause resource exhaustion on low-spec hardware nodes? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/indexer_table_info_config.rs] [Enum: TableInfoServiceMode] [Bucket name validation] Are GCS bucket names validated against GCS naming rules (lowercase, 3-63 chars, no special chars), or can invalid bucket names cause GcsBackupRestoreOperator initialization to fail silently, disabling backups? [File: aptos-core/config/src/config/indexer_table_info_config.rs] [Enum: TableInfoServiceMode] [Empty bucket name] Can an empty string be provided as the bucket name in Backup/Restore modes, causing the backup service to fail initialization or write to a default unintended bucket? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/indexer_table_info_config.rs] [Enum: TableInfoServiceMode] [Unicode/UTF-8 attacks] Can bucket names contain malicious Unicode characters (e.g., right-to-left override, zero-width characters) that bypass validation but cause issues in GCS operations? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/indexer_table_info_config.rs] [Enum: TableInfoServiceMode] [Mode switching attack] If table_info_service_mode is changed from Backup to Restore while the service is running, can this cause race conditions where backup and restore operations run simultaneously, corrupting the database? [File: aptos-core/config/src/config/indexer_table_info_config.rs] [Method: is_enabled()] [Logic error] Does is_enabled() correctly return false only for Disabled, or is there a logic flaw where Backup/Restore/IndexingOnly modes can incorrectly return false, disabling critical indexing? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/indexer_table_info_config.rs] [Enum: TableInfoServiceMode] [Mode persistence] If the mode is changed in the config but the node doesn't restart, can stale mode values persist in memory, causing desynchronization between config and runtime behavior? (Medium)
